amendment.description: To express the sense of Congress that the Government of Iraq should not grant amnesty to persons known to have attacked, killed, or wounded members of the Armed Forces of the United States.

vote.text: Amendment SA 4265 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 79 - 19. Record Vote Number: 178.

action.text: Amendment SA 4265 proposed by Senator Nelson FL. (consideration: CR S5922-5927; text: CR S5922) To express the sense of Congress that the Government of Iraq should not grant amnesty to persons known to have attacked, killed, or wounded members of the Armed Forces of the United States.
Senate amendment agreed to: Amendment SA 4265 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 79 - 19. Record Vote Number: 178.
Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Amendment SA 4265 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 79 - 19. Record Vote Number: 178.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 4265 proposed by Senator Nelson FL.
